Parquet

Data Processing

Read and analyze Parquet file columns and metadata. Provides efficient access to columnar data storage for large scientific datasets.

1.0.0 Version
3 Actions
Jan 15 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Global Installation

uv pip install scientific-mcps

Individual MCP Installation

uv pip install "scientific-mcps[parquet]"

Direct Server

uv run mcp_parquet

Claude Desktop Configuration

{ "mcpServers": { "parquet": { "command": "uv", "args": ["run", "mcp_parquet"] } } }

Available Actions

  • read_columns
    Read specific columns from Parquet files
    Parameters: file_path, columns, row_filter
  • get_schema
    Get schema and column information from Parquet files
    Parameters: file_path, include_statistics
  • list_files
    List Parquet files in a directory
    Parameters: directory_path, recursive

Usage Examples

Parquet Data Access

// Read specific columns read_columns( file_path: "experiment_results.parquet", columns: ["temperature", "pressure", "timestamp"], row_filter: "temperature > 25" ) // Get file schema get_schema("experiment_results.parquet", include_statistics: true) // List parquet files list_files("./data/", recursive: true)

Data Analysis Pipeline

// Read parquet data read_columns("large_dataset.parquet", ["measurement", "error", "quality"]) // Process with pandas filter_data(parquet_data, "quality > 0.9") // Visualize results create_plot(filtered_data, "scatter", "measurement", "error")
